effect.1: All entangled Variations may activate involuntarily {{vars.stimulus}}, possibly at highly inconvenient moments for {{NAME}}. For Directed Variations, the Storyteller may offer a Beat to take direction of the Variation for a single turn on which {{NAME}} does not do so (or select its target and effect at random). Once activated, {{NAME}} can deactivate an entangled Variation as an instant action, even if the stimulus persists, but it might reactivate a short while later (turns in action scenes, minutes in other scenes) if the stimulus is still present.{{BR}}{{NAME}} may activate any entangled Variations voluntarily with a successful Scar Finesse roll.
effect.2: {{INLINEOPTION:vars.option}}{{BR}}Any Variations activated in this manner are considered Overt for this scene.{{BR}}{{NAME}} may activate any entangled Variations voluntarily with a successful Scar Finesse roll.
effect.3: All entangled Variations activate involuntarily <strong>{{vars.stimulus}} unless {{NAME}} makes a successful Scar Resistance roll. If exposure continues, the Storyteller may call for more Scar Resistance rolls — no more often than once per turn in action scenes, once every several minutes in non-action scenes — with a penalty equal to the number of consecutive successful Scar Resistance rolls {{NAME}} has made this scene.{{BR}}Any Variations activated in this manner are considered Overt for this scene.{{BR}}Once the Variations are active, {{NAME}} cannot deactivate them while in the presence of the stimulus. Getting clear of the stimulus often involves an instant action and a roll of some kind, depending on the circumstances.{{BR}}{{NAME}} may activate any entangled Variations voluntarily with a successful Scar Finesse roll.

uncontrollable.name: Uncontrollable
uncontrollable.tooltip: {{NAME}} cannot activate the entangled Variations except involuntarily.
